definition: to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Tear gas and bullets were used to disperse the crowd but emotions remained high.
sentences.chinese: 群众被催泪瓦斯和子弹驱散，但是情绪依然高张。

sentences.english: Riot police hurled tear gas canisters and smoke bombs into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察向人群中投掷了催泪瓦斯罐和烟幕弹。

sentences.english: When that didn't work, he used tear gas and live ammunition.
sentences.chinese: 不起作用时，他使用催泪瓦斯和实弹抵抗反动民众。

sentences.english: We are peacefully demonstrating while they are throwing tear gas and bullets," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们在进行和平示威，而他们发射催泪瓦斯和枪弹。

sentences.english: Just off Revolution Street, I walked into a pall of tear gas.
sentences.chinese: 刚走出革命街，我又被催泪瓦斯包围了。

sentences.english: Police use battons used batons and tear gas trying to try to restore order.
sentences.chinese: 警方起用了电警棍和催泪瓦斯以试图恢复秩序。

sentences.english: Riot police eventually broke up the demonstrations with water cannons and tear gas.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察用水炮和催泪瓦斯驱散了示威活动。
警察向示威者施放催泪瓦斯。

sentences.english: The authorities responded by using water cannons and tear gas to disperse the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 当局用高压水炮和催泪瓦斯驱散示威人群。

sentences.english: Troops used tear gas and rifle butts to break up the protests.
sentences.chinese: 军队使用催泪瓦斯和枪托驱散示威者。

sentences.english: Fortunately, tear gas is banned in South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，韩国禁止使用催泪瓦斯。

sentences.english: The C.O.s fire tear gas into the hall, sending the inmates scattering.
sentences.chinese: 狱警们向大厅发射了催泪瓦斯，驱散囚犯们。

sentences.english: Police fired shots in the air and teargas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察对空射击，并释放催泪瓦斯以驱散人群。

pinyin: jian3 yi4 zha4 dan4 zhuang1 zhi4
